perturbation.original_text: C. Subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable content agreement with such Licensor, the Net Advertising Revenue shall be calculated on a quarterly calendar basis (the "Net Advertising Revenue Period") and shall be payable no later than sixty (60) days after the termination of the preceding full quarter-annual period, i.e., commencing on the first (1st) day of January, April, July and October except that the first and last calendar periods may be "short," depending on the effective date of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: C. Subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable content agreement with such Licensor, the Net Advertising Revenue shall be calculated on a quarterly calendar basis (the "Net Advertising Revenue Period") and shall be payable no later than thirty (30) days after the termination of the preceding full quarter-annual period, i.e., commencing on the first (1st) day of January, April, July and October except that the first and last calendar periods may be "short," depending on the effective date of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction by shortening the payment deadline for Net Advertising Revenue from 60 days to 30 days. This contradicts any implicit or explicit expectations set elsewhere in the contract regarding payment timelines, creating uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: E. COMPANY’S obligation for the payment of the Net Advertising Revenue shall survive expiration or termination of this Agreement and will continue for as long as COMPANY continues to use the Content.
perturbation.changed_text: E. COMPANY’S obligation for the payment of the Net Advertising Revenue shall not survive expiration or termination of this Agreement and will cease immediately upon termination, regardless of COMPANY's continued use of the Content.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a direct contradiction to the original text, specifying that the obligation for payment of Net Advertising Revenue does not survive the termination of the agreement. This conflicts with the original provision ensuring payment as long as the content is used, creating uncertainty about payment obligations post-termination.

perturbation.original_text: B. COMPANY may, in its unfettered discretion, terminate this Agreement at any time after first giving CONTENT PROVIDER ten (10) days advance notice thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: B. COMPANY may, in its unfettered discretion, terminate this Agreement at any time without giving CONTENT PROVIDER any advance notice thereof.
perturbation.explanation: This edit directly conflicts with the 10-day notice period for termination previously specified. This contradiction creates ambiguity about the process and conditions required for contract termination, introducing legal uncertainty and potential disputes.
